name: Los Angeles Mission: Food & Shelter
description: The Los Angeles Mission has a long history of providing emergency food baskets to those in need. description: The Valley Food Bank was established in 2001 to serve the food insecure in the San Fernando Valley. Our warehouse facility is a central hub that collects, processes, and distributes surplus food at no-charge to a network of rescue centers, food pantries, and soup kitchens to provide hot nutritious meals and food baskets to the homeless and needy throughout the community.For more information, please call.

description: We distribute food.Hours:The last Saturday of month 9:00am to 12:00pmFood distribution is one box per family, if picking up for someone else you must first have that person fill out a form authorizing you  to do so.Requirements:Must bring a copy of ID of person authorizing you.For more information, please call.

name: Norwalk Social Services Food Pantry
description: The Norwalk Social Services Center offers a wide range of emergency and support services to residents in crisis situations. Our goal is to assist individuals and families, whose resources have been exhausted, stabilize their situation and seek long-term solutions. Offer Emergency Food Pantry. Adults 60 years and older are welcome to enjoy hot nutritious meals.Hours:Monday - Friday 11:30amFor more information, please call.

name: Community Distribution Center
description: Community Distribution Center (CDC) is an Emergency Feeding Organization (EFO) providing hunger relief to families living in poverty in the San Fernando Valley. CDC solicits and distributes more than 3 million pounds of food and non-food items annually impacting nearly18,000 people. CDC operates out of a large facility (former grocery store) located in Sun Valley, CA -we are open six days a week and provides one shopping cart full of approximately 200 pounds of food per visit, providing sustenance for a family of seven for a week.
